intro: Caryophyllea praecox, commonly known as the early carnation, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features succulent, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is complemented by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
